content:
• Wednesday, May 13, 2015
  • NTES

    NetEase up 4.6% after hours on solid Q1 beat

    • Chinese online/game developer NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) has picked up 4.6% after hours (atop today's 1.8% gain) after posting earnings that beat expectations on top and bottom lines for Q1 and grew revenues more than 50%.
    • New games and content brought in substantial new revenues, CEO William Ding said. The company's flagship mobile game, Fantasy Westward Journey, reached No. 1 in the iOS China app store and hit a peak concurrent user count of 1.6M after a March intro. The company also works with Blizzard, and sold more than 1M copies of the Chinese version of Diablo III: Reaper of Souls in 10 days, and plans open beta testing for Heroes of the Storm later this month.
    • Advertising gains got a boost from automobile, Internet services and food and beverage ads.
    • Revenues by segment: Online game services, $500.76M (up 44%); Advertising services, $53.66M (up 35.9%); E-mail, e-commerce and others, $72.3M (up 278%).
    • Gross profit margins: online games, 73.1% (down from prior year 78.5%); ad services, 59.2% (up from 47.8%); e-mail, e-commerce and others, 38.9% (up from 6.7%).
    • Cash and time deposits stood at $3.6B at quarter's end.
    • Conference call at 9 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 PM
  • JONE

    Jones Energy in 5M-share secondary offering

    • Jones Energy (OTC:JONE) -6.2%Â AH after announcing a secondary public offering of 5M common shares by certain stockholders affiliated with Metalmark Capital representing ~22% the fund manager's current ownership in the company.
    • The underwriter will have an option to purchase up to an additional 750K shares from Metalmark.
    • JONE will receive no proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • PBYI

    Puma down 21.3% after releasing neratinib abstracts

    • Puma Biotechnology (NYSE:PBYI) has tumbled to $165.00 in AH trading after releasing 4 abstracts for its PB272 (neratinib) breast cancer drug that will be presented at the ASCO annual meeting (runs from May 29-June 2).
    • The abstracts are available on ASCO's site. Puma initiated a Phase 2 study for neratinib in March.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip up 9.8% on Q1 beat, guidance hike, margin improvement

    • With a healthy Q1 beat in tow, Ctrip (NASDAQ:CTRP) is now guiding for 45%-50% 2015 revenue growth, at the high end of a prior 40%-50% guidance range. Consensus is at 42.2%.
    • Segment performance: Accommodation (hotel) revenue rose 45% Y/Y in Q1 to $154M, an acceleration from Q4's 31% growth. Transportation ticket revenue (dominated by air tickets) rose 46% to $153M (improved from Q4's 34%). Packaged tour revenue rose 53% to $64M, and corporate travel revenue 31% to $15M.
    • Financials: Gross margin (under pressure in recent quarters) was 70%, down from Q1 2014's 72% but up from Q4's 69%. Spending remains aggressive: R&D spend rose 83% Y/Y to $130M, sales/marketing 68% to $117M, and G&A 36% to $42M. Op. margin (non-GAAP) was -1%, down from 12% a year ago but up from -14% in Q4.
    • Hotel reservation and ticketing volume respectively rose 60% and 104%. Mobile accounted for 70% of online transactions, and cumulative mobile app downloads topped 800M.
    • Ctrip has jumped to $71.75 AH, making new 52-week highs along the way.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com beats by $0.12, beats on revenue

    • Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP): Q1 EPS of -$0.15 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $373.41M (+46.8% Y/Y) beats by $10.81M.
    • Shares +6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VBLT +12.8%. VIPS +4.5%. ACRX +3.0%. AEGR +2.9%. RNDY +2.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PBYI -24.0%. ANY -8.3%. CAMT -6.8%. MTZ -4.3%. VOXX -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • CSCO

    FireEye -4%; Cisco's Chambers shoots down M&A rumor

    • During Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) FQ3 earnings call, John Chambers said he "would not bet" on a security M&A rumor heard today.
    • That was an apparent reference to FireEye (NASDAQ:FEYE), whose shares jumped on unconfirmed rumors that Cisco had made a bid.
    • FireEye has fallen to $41.71 in AH trading following Chambers' remarks. Shares are still up $0.41 from Monday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 14 Comments
  • CY

    Cypress makes $19.75/share offer to buy Integrated Silicon

    • In an open letter, Cypress Semi (NASDAQ:CY) has offered $19.75/share in cash ($711M, or $575M net of cash on hand) to acquire fellow chipmaker Integrated Silicon (NASDAQ:ISSI). ISSI is 2 months removed from agreeing to a $19.25/share acquisition by a Chinese consortium.
    • Cypress, of course, is only 2 months removed from closing its $5B all-stock merger with Spansion. With post-merger integration apparently proceeding well - Cypress recently upped its target for post-merger cost synergies by $25M/year to $160M/year - the company might feel it can also reap major cost synergies from an ISSI deal.
    • ISSI's product line includes DRAM, SRAM, and NOR flash, as well as audio amplifiers, LED drivers, and a variety of other analog/mixed-signal chips - the post-merger Cypress already has plenty of memory and mixed-signal exposure. Cypress' offer price is equal to less than 2x trailing sales after backing out net cash.
    • ISSI, which closed at $18.74 today, is halted. Cypress is down 1% AH to $12.53. Given the modest premium to the Chinese consortium's acquisition price, Cypress' offer might just be an opening bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • INVE

    Identiv down 14.6% on Q1 miss, full-year guidance cut

    • In addition to missing Q1 estimates, Identiv (NASDAQ:INVE) has cut its full-year revenue guidance to $90M-$95M from $95M-$105M (consensus is at $100.8M). The company still expects positive 2015 adjusted EBITDA.
    • The RFID/smart card ID system provider blames the Q1 miss on "an unexpected decline in the first quarter in our international desktop reader business and generally unfavorable conditions in Europe, as well as the typical first quarter seasonality and an unfavorable foreign currency impact." Premises and credential product sales were stronger.
    • Gross margin rose to 41% from 39% a year ago, and operating expenses rose 5% to $10.1M. Identiv's cash balance fell by $3.4M Q/Q to $33.1M (compares with a current market cap of $84M).
    • Shares have tumbled to $7.60 AH.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • TGB

    Taseko Mines beats by $0.07, misses on revenue

    • Taseko Mines (NYSEMKT:TGB): Q1 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $61.83M (-41.1% Y/Y) misses by $10.34M.
    • Shares +3.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • TCON

    Tracon misses by $0.29

    • Tracon (NASDAQ:TCON): Q1 EPS of -$0.50 misses by $0.29.
    • Revenue of $1.13M (+213.9% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • EYES

    Second Sight reports Q1 results

    • Second Sight (NASDAQ:EYES): Q1 EPS of -$0.12 vs. -$0.17 in 1Q14
    • Revenue of $1.7M (+142.9% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • MSLI

    Merus Labs reports FQ2 results

    • Merus Labs (NASDAQ:MSLI): FQ2 net income of $2.2M
    • Revenue of $12.7M (+89.8% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • GEVO

    Gevo -11% AH on news of stock offering

    • Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) -10.9% AH after announcing a public offering of common stock units, consisting of one common share and a warrant to purchase additional common shares.
    • Gevo says it plans to use the proceeds to fund working capital and for other general corporate purposes.
    • A prescient article this morning from Street Sweeper said Gevo was "primed for a stock offering," noting the company is "money-starved" with just $4.4M in cash and a $10M/quarter cash burn rate.
    • Shares had opened more than 20% higher after reporting a smaller than expected Q1 loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • ANY

    Sphere 3D posts 3.9% gain following virtualization deal

    • Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) has signed a master purchase agreement with radiology facility owner Novarad to provide its virtualization products/services to 400 facilities.
    • The companies will "establish a rolling 90 day schedule for refreshing healthcare facilities with virtualization technology throughout the United States." The first implementations are set for Q3. Sphere's V3 PC virtualization and Glassware 2.0 app virtualization solutions are covered, as are its SnapScale and SnapServer NAS storage systems.
    • Shares rallied to $3.72 in regular trading. They spiked as high as $4.12 before paring their gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • PGNPQ

    Paragon Offshore beats by $0.24, beats on revenue

    • Paragon Offshore (PGN): Q1 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.24.
    • Revenue of $430.6M (-16.3% Y/Y) beats by $11.88M.
    • Shares +9.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • JCP

    Margins improve at J.C. Penney in Q1

    • J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) saw same-store sales increase 3.4% in Q1.
    • Gross margin rate was +330 bps Y/Y to 36.4%.
    • SG&A expense rate -220 bps to 33.8%.
    • Operating income rate +620 bps to -2.60%.
    • Merchandise inventory flat Y/Y at $2.811B.
    • Categories of product strength included women's apparel, men's and home.
    • Guidance: J.C. Penney expects 2015 comps to rise 4% to 5% vs. 3%-5% prior view. Gross margin rate forecast to improve 100 bps to 150 bps. Free cash flow is expected to be breakeven.
    • Previously: J.C. Penney beats by $0.20, misses on revenue
    • JCPÂ +0.3%Â after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • SHAK

    Shake Shack +8% after double-digit Q1 comp

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) reports same-shack sales rose 11.2% in Q1Â vs consensus estimates for +7%.
    • Average weekly sales increased 7.2% to $89K as menu price hikes factored in.
    • Shack-level operating margin +270 bps to 25.7%.
    • Guidance: 2015 revenue of $161M-$165M expected vs. $164.8M consensus. Ten new domestic and five new licensed international stores are slated to be opened this year by the company.
    • Previously: Shake Shack beats by $0.07, beats on revenue
    • SHAKÂ +7.96%Â after hours to $73.80 after a 4.16% gain before the bell.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • VIPS

    Vipshop beats estimates, offers light guidance

    • Vipshop Holdings (NYSE:VIPS): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $1.39B (+99.8% Y/Y) beats by $100M.
    • Expects Q2 revenue of RMB8.7B-RMB8.9B ($1.4B-$1.43B), below a $1.45B consensus.
    • Shares +2.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • CBI

    CB&I wins Rio Grande LNG contract

    • CB&I (CBI +5.5%) is up sharply following news of a contract award with NextDecade LLC for front end engineering and design services related to the Rio Grande liquefied natural gas export project in Brownsville, Tex.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed, but the scope of work includes all design and engineering activities required for the FERC permitting process, as well as for preparation for procurement of critical equipment prior to the final investment decision.
    • The project includes plans for up to six liquefaction trains with a nominal output capacity of 4.5M metric tons/year of LNG.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • WMB

    Energy MLPs muddled despite Williams deal for Williams Partners

    • Energy MLPs are trading with mixed results, which is not in line with an analyst's expectation that several names in the space may be outperformers today after Williams Cos. (WMB +6.2%) agreed to buy Williams Partners (WPZ +22.7%).
    • In an earlier note to investors, Credit Suisse named Plains GP Holdings (PAGP +1%), Targa Resources (TRGP +1.1%), NuStar GP Holdings (NSH -0.1%) and Western Gas Equity (WGP -0.7%) as MLPs that could climb on the news.
    • Meanwhile, Wells Fargo says the deal is positive, since it reduces the WMB's cost of capital, will immediately increase its profits, and enhances its dividend growth outlook.
    • Among major energy MLPs: EPD -1.5%, ETP +0.9%, PAA +0.2%, EEP -0.2%, MWE +2.2%, MMP -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 17 Comments
  • PED

    Pedevco launches 5.6M-share offering, shares -25%

    • Pacific Energy Development (PED -25.3%) plunges after it priced its public offering of 5.6M common shares at $0.50/share.
    • The underwriters were granted an option to purchase up to 840K shares to cover any over-allotments.
    • PED says it plans to use the proceeds to extend and acquire additional leasehold rights in the Denver-Julesburg Basin in Colorado, fund working capital and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave down 12.3% post-earnings

    • DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) has tumbled after providing weak FQ1 guidance to go with an FQ4 beat yesterday afternoon.
    • With liquidity concerns an issue - the cash balance fell by $5.8M Q/Q in FQ4 to $23.7M - shares now trade for only 0.3x FY14 revenue of $157.8M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • RENN

    Renren +3.8% after beating Q1 guidance, forecasting sales growth

    • Though down 41.1% Y/Y, Renren's (NYSE:RENN) Q1 revenue of $13.7M was above guidance of $11M-$13M (set on March 18). In addition, the hard-luck Chinese social networking/gaming firm is guiding for revenue to rise to $15M-$17M (still down 25.8%-34.5% Y/Y) in Q2.
    • Online ad sales (social networking-related) fell 62.9% Y/Y in Q1 to $2.3M, and gaming revenue fell 56.5% to $5.5M. However, value-added service revenue rose 35% to $5.9M thanks to Renren's Woxiu social video platform. Monthly logged-in users were 46M, flat Q/Q and down 5M Y/Y.
    • Operating expenses fell 16.6% Y/Y to $29.7M. Renren ended Q1 with $413M in cash/short-term investments, $579M in long-term investments (inc. Renren's investments in online lending firms), and no debt. The company's market cap is currently just $698M.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • DHR

    Analysts like Danaher's purchase of Pall, but it did not come cheap

    • Danaher (DHR +1.2%) paid a high price in its $127.20/share deal for Pall (PLL-OLD +4.5%), valuing the filtration and purification company at ~22x EBITDA in the last year, roughly double the median multiple paid for big industrial and life sciences equipment acquisitions in the last five years, according to Bloomberg.
    • But Janney analysts like the purchase and DHR's decision to split itself into two companies, noting DHR had less than 5% exposure to the rapidly growing pharma/biotech end-markets; the consolidation enables it to penetrate the rapidly growing biopharma market and will more than double DHR’s exposure to pharmaceutical customers.
    • PLL is the no. 2 or no. 3 player in the overall bioproduction market, accounting for one-third of revenues, and is growing at a 10%-plus organic clip with 25%-30% margins, the firm says, adding that it expects continued strong growth as industry dynamics are still evolving.
    • Janney thinks more acquisitions could be on the way, speculating that DHR/PLL could circle Repligen (NASDAQ:RGEN) on the belief that bioproduction media remains a gap in its product portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • QIWI

    Qiwi up 7.4% ahead of earnings

    • QIWI is up sharply ahead of tomorrow morning's Q1 report. With the help of a rebounding ruble (has followed oil prices higher), the Russian online payments leader is now up 50% YTD.
    • Bloomberg provided some positive coverage yesterday afternoon: Among other things, it noted Qiwi has expanded its network of cash payment kiosks to 181K as major Russian banks close branches. IR chief Yakov Barinsky: “Many Russian retail banks, especially those that don’t operate a significant network of branches, choose to use our kiosks to collect loan payments."
    • Bloomberg also provided a positive quote from Sberbank analyst Anna Lepetukhina. "Russia is a cash country, and there is demand for cash payments -- ranging from loan repayments to utility bill payments -- which all can be done via Qiwi terminals.”
    • UBS upgraded to Buy last week, citing improving macro conditions. Shares now go for 20x 2015E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • DWDP

    DuPont's victory over Trian is not good news, Citi says

    • DuPont (DD -6%) remains sharply lower after Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund Management lost its proxy fight and failed to get any of its nominees elected to the company's board, and Citigroup analysts agree that it's not good news.
    • Although Trian lost, Citi thinks DuPont will be under greater shareholder scrutiny going forward even though the result was a big win for CEOÂ Ellen Kullman and management, with cost reductions and share repurchases taking the primary focus in the near-term.
    • DuPont also "may have to play more offense" in agriculture after spending the last several months playing defense in the proxy battle; the firm says it sees logic in combining DD's and Dow Chemical's (DOW) ag businesses.
    • Trian may not be patient and may exit its position over time, offering a potential overhang on DD shares, Citi says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 23 Comments
  • TSEM

    TowerJazz down 5.6% in spite of Q1 beat, solid Q2 guidance

    • On top of beating Q1 estimates, TowerJazz (NASDAQ:TSEM) has guided for Q2 revenue of $235M (+/- 5%), above a $233.2M consensus at the midpoint. With shares up 90% from their October low going into earnings and major client Skyworks having provided strong results/guidance, expectations were somewhat high.
    • Q1 organic Y/Y revenue growth (takes the Panasonic JV deal into account) was 33%; it was 71% overall. Photomasks entering the Israeli specialty foundry's fabs rose 37% (45% inc. the Panasonic JV). Gross margin rose to 36% from 34% a year ago, and operating expenses 73% to $29.4M. Net debt stood at $162M at quarter's end.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 8 Comments
  • MM

    Millennial Media up 8% since Verizon/AOL deal

    • Like fellow online ad plays Rocket Fuel and The Rubicon Project, Millennial Media (MM +4.5%) has rallied after Verizon announced it's buying AOL for $4.4B, a deal that's widely seen as being ad-focused.
    • Millennial, hit hard by competition from Google, Facebook, and Apple's mobile ad platforms, wouldn't be too hard for a tech or telecom giant to digest: Its market cap is currently $237M. The company has occasionally popped up in M&A speculation over the last 3 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSLT

    Castlight up 9.6% after Najarian buys in

    • optionMONSTER's Jon Najarian states on CNBC he bought into Castlight (NYSE:CSLT). Najarian highlights heavy call-buying before Monday's close and a large short interest - 8.8M shares (27% of the float) were shorted as of April 30.
    • The enterprise cloud healthcare software vendor is adding to the Monday gains it saw after announcing Viacom had been added as a client.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • OPWR

    Opower up 6.1% after Q1 beat, mixed guidance, major contract

    • Though down in premarket trading after providing a soft Q2 outlook to go with its Q1 beat, Opower (NYSE:OPWR) has since rallied above $11. Shares went into earnings down nearly 50% from a 52-week high of $20.45.
    • The cloud electricity service management software firm expects Q2 revenue of $34.8M-$35.5M and EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.17, mostly below a consensus of $35.6M and -$0.17. Full-year guidance is better: Revenue of $144M-$149M and EPS of -$0.58 to -$0.68 vs. a consensus of $146.8M and -$0.69.
    • Also: Opower announced it has signed a contract with California utility PG&E that's the largest in the company's history. Revenue recognition will start in 2016.
    • William Blair notes the contract is worth $90M over 7 years, and sees it as evidence Opower can grow sales to existing customers. The firm is also pleased with international deal activity, believes full-year guidance is conservative, and observes management thinks Opower "remains on track to return to 20% revenue growth in 2016 and achieve positive adjusted EBITDA in 2017."
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM

  • Bond yields reverse, head higher

    • After a big fall following the weak retail sales number, the 10-year Treasury yield has jumped 10 basis points in the past couple of hours, now up 3 bps on the session to 2.28%.
    • The move came alongside a sizable reversal in Europe - yields there popped late in the session and finished higher across the board.
    • Earlier, the Atlanta Fed updated its GDP Now model to reflect the last week's worth of economic data, and now sees GDP growth of just 0.7% in Q2.
    • JPMorgan slashes its Q2 GDP growth forecast to 2% from 2.5%, which would put H1 growth at just 0.5%. Bank economist Michael Feroli says this weakness isn't flowing through to the labor market, however, and as long as employment remains robust, his team's call for a September liftoff in rates remains.
    • TLT, TBT flat on the session.
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, UBT, DLBS, TLO, TENZ, LBND, DLBL, TYBS, VUSTX
    • Previously: Treasurys add to gains after disappointing retail sales number (May 13)
    • Previously: Retail sales continue to slow (May 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 5 Comments
  • ECA

    Encana downgraded at RBC, which prefers stronger balance sheet

    • Encana (ECA -2.7%) is downgraded to Sector Perform from Outperform with a $15 price target at RBC, which thinks ECA's next goal will be balance sheet deleveraging, even though its average net-to-trailing cash flow ratio of 4.5x in 2015 is expected to fall to 2.7x in 2016.
    • The firm says it would prefer to see ECA strengthen its balance sheet, particularly given limited hedging next year; ECA has hedged 46% of its estimated gas production and 31% of its forecast oil production for 2015, but only 1% of its expected 2016 production.
    • While ECA's operating momentum in its four biggest plays looks to be gaining traction and Q1 results included significantly better oil and liquids realizations, RBC essentially sees more attractive opportunities elsewhere.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • INSG

    Novatel up 5.8% after big options buy

    • optionMONSTER reports 5,600 Novatel (MIFI) December calls sporting a $4 strike price were purchased this morning at prices ranging from $1.17-$1.45. The positions are new; open interest for the calls was only 41 going into today.
    • Going into today, Novatel had fallen 21% since beating Q1 revenue estimates and posting in-line EPS last Tuesday; and offering similar Q2 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OHGI +109%.DSCO +26%. RENT +21%. GWGH +18%. XNET +16%.OTC:DSKX +15%.SSRI +13%. INUV +12%. BPTH +11% .ZBRA +10% .
    • Losers: DCO -21%. RMD -15%. SBLK -12%. ELMD -11%. PER -11%. ATV -9%. VTAE -9%. XENE -9%.  NSTG  -8% . EBR -8% .
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    EZchip guides in-line, talks up non-Cisco designs; shares -21.9%

    • EZchip (EZCH) has guided on its Q1 CC (prepared remarks - .pdf) for Q2 revenue of $27.5M-$28.5, in-line with a $28.3M consensus. Gross margin is expected to be around 75% - it was at 74% in Q1, down from 81.7% a year ago thanks to the Tilera acquisition.
    • The company also tried hard to argue it can offset Cisco's decision not to use EZchip's NPS-400 NPU in its next-gen edge router line cards with various NPS-400 design wins from carriers, networking hardware vendors, and (Internet) data center owners. Tilera's TILE-Mx processors (support up to 100 ARM cores, aimed at data centers) were also cited as a future growth driver.
    • Cisco accounted for 35% of EZchip's Q1 revenue, and ZTE 8%; Cisco sales are expected to grow in 2015 as NP-5 shipments ramp. The NPS processor line is expected to start producing revenue "as early as 2016," and the TILE-Mx line in 2017.
    • Shares remain down sharply, but have slightly pared their premarket losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • ICCC

    ImmuCell up big on Q1 results

    • Thinly traded nano cap ImmuCell (ICCC +35.2%) jumps on a 17x surge volume, albeit on turnover of only 113K, in response to its announcement of Q1 results after yesterday's close. It was the firm's most profitable quarter in 12 years.
    • Sales were up 49% while its First Defense scours treatment for calves grew 62%. Net income was $479K or $0.15 per share.
    • The company develops products that improve animal health and productivity in the dairy and beef industries.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • GOLD

    WSJ: Barrick Gold, Glencore considering sale of nickel project in Tanzania

    • Barrick Gold (ABX +4%) and Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY) are looking to sell a joint nickel development project in Tanzania, WSJ reports.
    • The two miners each own half of the Kabanga nickel project and reportedly have been touting the project for several months, although neither company has hired a bank to sell the property.
    • However, some bankers believe that, while Kabanga’s ore is of a high grade, a sale may prove difficult given the smaller size of the field of potential buyers vs. other metals such as gold or iron ore.
    • Also, Kabanaga is considered in a remote location with little infrastructure, and nickel prices - which have been rising in recent weeks but is down 31% from two-year highs reached last May - remain volatile.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • VEON

    VimpelCom up 7% after earnings, Italy merger progress

    • VimpelCom (VIP) is up 7% now following news of progress on its Italy-unit merger and earnings that grew despite revenues that slipped 30%, pummeled by currency exchange.
    • EBITDA was down 30% Y/Y as well (to $1.396B, vs. expected $1.43B), but on an organic basis, revenues were down 2% and EBITDA down 6%, in line with management's expectations. EBITDA margin fell to 39.7% from a year-ago 41.6%.
    • Organic revenues were flat or down in the company's biggest geographies: Russia, $1.04B (flat on organic basis); Italy, $1.11B (down 5%); Algeria, $320M (down 11%).
    • Mobile customers increased 2% to 218M. Customer base in Algeria gained 6% to 18.7M and Bangladesh 8% to 31.8M. Italy customers slipped 3% to 21.4M, while Russia gained 1% to 55.7M.
    • The company stuck to current guidance for 2015: organic service revenue flat to a single-digit decline, EPS of $0.35-$0.40 (vs. consensus $0.40) and net debt/EBITDA of about 3.2x (1.7x, excluding Italy unit). It plans to update shareholders on strategy in August.

  • VIPS

    Vipshop responds to critical SA column; shares +3.7% ahead of earnings

    • A day after SA author Mithra Forensic Research asserted Vipshop (NYSE:VIPS) "has manipulated sales, receivables, profit and other asset accounts" (among other things), the Chinese online retailer has responded (in a statement that echoes responses from other firms facing similar accusations) by declaring it believes the allegations "are unfounded and contain numerous errors, unsupported speculation, and a general misunderstanding of the Company's business model."
    • Among Mithra's accusations: 1) Vipshop's inventory figures suggest the company improperly accounts for consignment goods (boosting gross margin). 2) Revenue is reported on a gross basis in spite of consignment arrangements. 3) The company "may have grown its 2014 gross profit by $573M by possibly diverting funds to related parties to be used to transact fake sales." 4) Op. cash flow growth is driven "not by earnings, but by significant growth in both accounts payables and accrued expenses as a result of not paying its bills."
    • Vipshop argues its gross revenue accounting is proper, that it uses an "appropriate" weighted-average-cost method to account for inventory held on consignment, and that its receivables growth isn't due to related-party transactions, but higher deposits and VAT receivables.
    • Shares are rallying ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report. They sold off yesterday following Mithra's report; several other Chinese Internet names were also lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 2 Comments

    Cellcom launching triple-play package in competitive Israel

    • Fresh off early steps into pay-TV provisioning, Israeli mobile provider Cellcom (CEL -1.4%) is launching a triple-play package offering family savings (and, it hopes, drawing new revenue streams amid hot competition).
    • The company is expanding from on-demand TV service launched in December (99 shekels/month, about $25.70) to offer wireline phone and high-speed Internet in a package that would cost 149-169 shekels (roughly $39-$44) vs. what the company says is some 439 shekels a month for the separate services.

  • MLNX

    EZchip -27.1%; Cisco doesn't plan to use NPS-400

    • EZchip (EZCH) uses its Q1 report to state its largest customer (i.e. Cisco) doesn't currently plan to use EZchip's NPS-400 network processor (NPU) in its next-gen edge router line cards.
    • The company adds Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) recently began using EZchip's NP-5 NPU (entered production in late 2014), that it doesn't think "a next generation successor for the NP-5 is likely to ship for approximately three years," and that the NP-5 is expected to "continue generating revenues at this customer for several more years beyond this three year period."
    • Concerns that Cisco could drop EZchip in favor of an in-house NPU have been around since the networking giant unveiled its nPower X1 NPU in Sep. 2013. At the time, EZchip said it believes Cisco hasn't made a decision on which processor will succeed the NP-5.
    • Today,Â  EZchip says it believes Cisco's next-gen edge router line cards will require more throughput than is provided by the NPS-400 (480 Gbps), and that Cisco is "currently developing such a solution in-house." EZchip, for its part, is working on an NPS-400 successor (the 1Tbps NPS-1000) that it hopes to sell Cisco on. The NPS-400 begins sampling in 2H15, and is being considered for other platforms at Cisco (as well as other clients).
    • EZchip has tumbled to $14.28 in premarket trading.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 3 Comments
